org.gannacademy.cdf.turtlelogo

Class AnimatedTurtle

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gannacademy.cdf.turtlelogo.Turtle
      • org.gannacademy.cdf.turtlelogo.AnimatedTurtle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class AnimatedTurtle
extends Turtle
implements Runnable
    Animated turtles are turtles that move more slowly, so that we can observe them following their instructions. Their speed can be adjusted either when they are instantiated or as a separate instruction (speed(long))
    Author:
    Seth Battis

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_FRAME_DELAY

        public static final long DEFAULT_FRAME_DELAY
        10 milliseconds
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TURN_SPEED_CUTOFF

        public static final long TURN_SPEED_CUTOFF

        25 milliseconds

        This is an internal measure, sued to determine how and when to animate turtle turns (frame delays longer than this cutoff will have the turns animated in larger steps

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move(double steps)
        Description copied from class: Turtle

        Move the turtle in the direction of its current heading

        A positive value for steps is interpreted as forward movement and a negative value as backward movement

        Overrides:
        move in class Turtle
        Parameters:
        steps - in pixels

      • turn

        public void turn(double angle)
        Description copied from class: Turtle

        Turn the turtle from its current heading

        A positive angle is interpreted as a right turn and a negative angle is a left turn. This is mildly surprising if you know about the unit circle, but is because the Y-axis of the window increases from top to bottom, which results in a mirrored unit circle around the X-axis, with 90° at the Turtle.SOUTH and270° at the Turtle.NORTH

        Overrides:
        turn in class Turtle
        Parameters:
        angle - in degrees

      • head

        public void head(double heading)
        Description copied from class: Turtle

        Turn the turtle to a particular heading

        Note that, because the Y-axis of the window increases from top to bottom, the usual angles of the unit circle have been mirrored around the X-axis, with 90° at the Turtle.SOUTH and 270%deg; at the Turtle.NORTH. Convenience constants have been provided for the cardinal directions.

        Overrides:
        head in class Turtle
        Parameters:
        heading - [0..360) in degrees

      • penColor

        public void penColor(Color color)
        Description copied from class: Turtle

        Set the color of the turtle's pen

        Color values are given as Color values. Color has a number of helpful constants like Color.GREEN or Color.GREEN. Custom colors can also be constructed. Refer to the java.awt.Color API documentation more details (including how to create transparent colors!)

        Overrides:
        penColor in class Turtle
        Parameters:
        color - to use

      • hide

        public void hide()
        Description copied from class: Turtle

        Hide the turtle

        Hiding the turtle causes it to become invisible — it can still be moved and create tracks, but the turtle itself is not visible

        Overrides:

      • teleport

        public void teleport(double x,
                     double y)
        Description copied from class: Turtle

        Move the turtle instantaneously to a particular location

        The turtle moves directly to the window coordinates (x, y). Note that the origin of the wind ow is in the top, left corner and that, while the X-axis increases from left to right, the Y-axis increases from to to bottom.

        No track is left by a teleportation.

        Overrides:
        teleport in class Turtle
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate
        y - coordinate

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(double x,
                   double y)
        Description copied from class: Turtle

        Move the turtle to a particular location

        The turtle moves directly to the window coordinates (x, y). Note that the origin of the wind ow is in the top, left corner and that, while the X-axis increases from left to right, the Y-axis increases from to to bottom.

        If the turtle's pen is currently down, the move will create a track from the old location to the new location.

        Overrides:
        moveTo in class Turtle
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate
        y - coordinate

      • home

        public void home()
        Description copied from class: Turtle

        Reset the turtle to its home position

        The turtle's home position is at the center of the window, heading Turtle.EAST

        Overrides:
        home in class Turtle

      • sp

        public void sp(long frameDelay)
        Alias for speed(long)
        Parameters:
        frameDelay - in milliseconds

      • speed

        public void speed(long frameDelay)

        Set the speed of the turtle's animation

        The frame delay is the time between individual frames of animation. Shorter frame delays (below TURN_SPEED_CUTOFF) will cause turn animations to be animated in more detail to allow them to remain visible to the naked eye

        Parameters:
        frameDelay - in milliseconds

      • run

        public void run()

        Thread execution

        This method is the control loop that allows animation to be updated in a separate control loop for each turtle. This method should not be called by students (although calling it manually should do nothing).

        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • draw

        public void draw(Graphics2D context,
                 Terrarium.UnderTheSurface key)
        Description copied from class: Turtle

        Draw the turtle

        May only be called by Terrarium and its subclasses, enforced by Terrarium.UnderTheSurface

        Overrides:
        draw in class Turtle
        Parameters:
        context - for drawing commands
        key - to authenticate "Terrarium-iality"
